content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic adenocarcinoma, head of pancreas

Management:		15 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:		Undifferentiated carcinoma, pT3N0M0, R0 resection
			BRAF V600E mutation positive

Current situation:	Post-operative surveillance

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She has made an excellent recovery from her Whipple's procedure performed in January. Her weight has stabilized at 62kg and appetite continues to improve with pancreatic enzyme replacement. She reports no new symptoms of concern. Her diabetes remains well-controlled on current insulin regimen.

CT scan performed last week shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests including CA19-9 are within normal range.

The plan is to continue surveillance with 3-monthly CA19-9 measurements and 6-monthly CT scans. Next clinic review will be in 3 months with repeat blood tests. She understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns arise.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

status_updates.value: Resected pancreatic cancer under post-operative surveillance. Excellent recovery from surgery with no evidence of recurrence.
Review in clinic in 3 months with blood tests
